metadata.title: CVE-2016-5696 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
net/ipv4/tcp_input.c in the Linux kernel before 4.7 does not properlydetermine the rate of challenge ACK segments, which makes it easier forremote attackers to hijack TCP sessions via a blind in-window attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-95-generic - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-lowlatency - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-3.13.0-95-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-95.142
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-95-generic - 3.13.0-95.142
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-68-generic - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-lowlatency - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-68-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-68.76~14.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-lowlatency - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-36-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-36.55~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-95.142').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
